channel.description: Recent content in Defense and Military Forces on PepsFeeder

item.title: Between the Offensives> Images From a Journey in Ukraine’s Borderland
item.description: by Marko Strojin In the summer of 2014, I traveled to the Donbas region of eastern Ukraine, where a war between Ukrainian government forces and pro-Russian separatists had been raging for several months.

item.title: For the First French Town Liberated on D-Day, History Is Personal
item.description: By JAMES G. NEUSS Published: June 6, 2014 Sainte-Mère-Église, France — The American paratrooper who landed here on D-Day, June 6, 1944, was supposed to be a replacement for a soldier who had been killed.

item.title: Bombed and Bruised, a City Braces for Another Russian Onslaught
item.description: MOSCOW — The Russian military has been pounding Ukraine’s eastern Donbas region for weeks, and now it is turning its attention to the capital, Kyiv.

item.title: Inside the Base Where Israel Has Detained Thousands of Gazans
item.description: Inside the Base Where Israel Has Detained Thousands of Gazans Israeli soldiers stand guard at the Erez crossing between Israel and the Gaza Strip on July 16, 2018.

item.title: D-Day at 80
item.description: : The Battle of Normandy D-Day at 80: The Battle of Normandy D-Day at 80: The Battle of Normandy D-Day at 80: The Battle of Normandy

item.title: Ukraine Strikes Into Russia With Western Weapons, Official Says
item.description: Ukraine has launched a series of strikes into Russian territory using Western-supplied weapons, a senior Ukrainian official said on Sunday, a move that could mark a significant escalation in the conflict.

item.title: For Heroes of D-Day, This Reunion Might Be a ‘Last Hurrah’
item.description: By JAMES BARRON Published: June 6, 2014 OMAHA BEACH, France — The men who stormed the beaches of Normandy 70 years ago are getting old, and many are dying.

item.title: Blinken Hints U.S. May Allow Ukraine Greater Latitude to Strike in Russia
item.description: -Controlled Territories U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken hinted on Sunday that the United States may allow Ukraine greater latitude to strike at targets in Russia-controlled territories, as the war in Ukraine enters its second year.
